programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Bordeaux, a day unlike any other We join Éric Perrin for a stroll through the city of Bordeaux as he meets some particularly surprising local characters. A journey that begins when the city is still asleep, but the dawn workers are already busy. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Present worldwide, Relais & Châteaux promotes the luxury hotel sector. Cooked upside down and eaten in situ: the Tatin pie, a mouthwatering mistake. The jewellery creator Annelise Michelson moves into design.. Wearing a tie. Akho: the brainchild of a designer launching an eco-responsible brand.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: The free life of a vegan nomad Joëlle, a vegan nomad, took the decision to abandon city life for the peace and quiet of the Rockies. Discussing her life with Julien, she sets out all the advantages of living in the great outdoors, surrounded by breathtaking scenery. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Ice lollies
Ice lollies, from 2002 to today. Gelato, paletas... and not forgetting the affogato that combines two Italian passions: coffee and ice cream, plus vegan ice creams!
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La National Gallery of Art, Washington Fondée en 1937, la National Gallery of Art, à Washington, est l'un des plus imposants musées au monde par l'importance des oeuvres présentées. Les collections sont réparties dans deux bâtiments distincts, reliés par une galerie sous le Mall. On y retrouvera les grands noms français de la peinture moderne. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Ardèche, from the gorges to the Haut-Vivarais A wild, unspoilt department, appreciated by tourists for its gorges the Ardèche is also a land of authentic villages beloved of artists. Which is how Antraigues-sur-Volane became Jean Ferrat's refuge. And for those who love good food there are plenty of irresistible local specialities such as "caillette" with sweet chestnuts. Directed by: Isabelle Le Guen (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Poitevin Marshes, the children of the marshland The Regional Natural Park of the Marais Poitevin stretches over three departments: the Vendée, Charente-Maritime and Deux-Sèvres. Sixty kilometres long by thirty kilometres wide, it is the largest wetland in France, after the Camargue. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
They're the future of fashion: discover the fashion show for students of the Institut Français de la Mode. Learn all about the padded jacket. Interview with Valentine H Despointes, a leatherwork artist. Wearing the colour brown. The architect Régis Botta presents one of his projects: a bright, simple duplex.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Michel Roth
He is one of France's most highly-qualified chefs. Michel Roth is back in Marseille, where he spent his childhood and learned his trade. An opportunity for the Lorraine-born chef to immerse himself in the land he loves, surrounded by family and friends: where good food is served with emotion.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as an outdoor adventure guide On the banks of Cambell River, Julien meets up with Bastian. Former banker turned helicopter pilot, he left Switzerland to start again from nothing. He takes Julien off to explore the endless playground that surrounds him, by boat, campervan and air. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Game meat
Venison, duck, boar, emu, elk, bison... What place does game have in our fridges today? Also on the programme: freeze-drying for zero waste; mascarpone, the king of Italian cream cheeses; and if, as they say, an army marches on its stomach, what do Canadian soldiers actually eat?
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Ardèche, from the gorges to the Haut-Vivarais A wild, unspoilt department, appreciated by tourists for its gorges the Ardèche is also a land of authentic villages beloved of artists. Which is how Antraigues-sur-Volane became Jean Ferrat's refuge. And for those who love good food there are plenty of irresistible local specialities such as "caillette" with sweet chestnuts. Sixty kilometres long by thirty kilometres wide, it is the largest wetland in France, after the Camargue. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Homemade corn tortillas
For an easy-to-prepare way to serve prawn tacos and a mango salsa, Ricardo cooks his own home-made corn tortillas for a flavour that's even more authentic.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Cooking for zero waste
The peel and leaves from fruit and vegetables aren't just edible, they're delicious! Also on the programme: why you need to look after your microbiota and how to go about it. What to drink instead of coffee? And Moldovan pickled gherkins.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Centre J. Paul Getty, Los Angeles Avec ses allures de « village italien dans les collines », le Getty Center comprend des expositions de sculpture et d'art classique, de peintures européennes, de dessins, manuscrits, arts décoratifs et de photographies. Sa collection de chefs-d'oeuvre de grands peintres français, du Valentin à Moreau, tient une place d'honneur. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Seine-Maritime, from the cliffs of Étretat to the bocage of Normandy The Seine-Maritime, between land and sea, from traditional Normandy "bocage" to the Étretat cliffs, is a fabulous spot rich with the historic remains of its glorious past. A journey marked by several surprising destinations: the Fécampe Benedictine Palace, the Aïeux mill, Veules-les-Roses where France's shortest river reaches the sea... Directed by: Vanessa Pontet (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Poitevin Marshes, the children of the marshland The Regional Natural Park of the Marais Poitevin stretches over three departments: the Vendée, Charente-Maritime and Deux-Sèvres. Sixty kilometres long by thirty kilometres wide, it is the largest wetland in France, after the Camargue. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Jouy-en-Josas, to visit the Toile de Jouy museum. The Argentinean chef Juan Arbelaez invites us into his kitchen, filled with a thousand and one flavours. Schiaparelli, the perfect combination of art and fashion through collections inspired by surrealism. The restorer Isabelle Pitre offers paintings and artworks all their original beauty. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Fried chicken and waffles Bob le Chef goes for a buttermilk-based cuisine with his two recipes today: fried chicken and waffles. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Éva and Alex, Montérégie (West Bolton) The birth of Éva and Alex's baby led them to leave their shared rental in the Rosemont district of Montreal for a house in Montérégie. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Aveiro (Portugal) Découverte du marché central d'Aveiro. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Picton, Ontario
Louis goes to Picton, in Ontario, to meet a client who is battling with a squirrel problem.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Breakfast for the "morning people" The chef Jean-Luc Boulay, from the restaurant Saint-Amour in Québec, offers the morning presenters, Patrick Masbourian, Ève-Marie Lortie and Kim Rusk, a real treat by preparing a meal that they had almost forgotten: breakfast. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

Ice lollies
Ice lollies, from 2002 to today. Gelato, paletas... and not forgetting the affogato that combines two Italian passions: coffee and ice cream, plus vegan ice creams!
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: L'ancienne et la nouvelle pinacothèque de Munich Halte dans deux « temples » allemands, dédiés à l'art, appréciés pour la richesse de leurs collections. L'ancienne pinacothèque de Munich recèle un grand nombre de tableaux de peintres français de la période classique, de Claude Lorrain à Fragonard. La nouvelle pinacothèque abrite, elle, les artistes romantiques et impressionnistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Gironde, from the Bassin d'Arcachon to Saint-Émilion There are so many different Girondes: that of Bordeaux, where 18th century buildings blend with contemporary architecture; that of the estuary, the largest in Europe and home to a diverse and exceptional wildlife; or that of the inland areas, with the renowned vineyards of the Médoc and Saint-Émilion. Directed by: Chloé L'Affeter (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Poitevin Marshes, the children of the marshland The Regional Natural Park of the Marais Poitevin stretches over three departments: the Vendée, Charente-Maritime and Deux-Sèvres. Sixty kilometres long by thirty kilometres wide, it is the largest wetland in France, after the Camargue. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Les profits grandissants des grandes chaînes d'alimentation
programme.desc:
Ever-higher profits for the major supermarket chains
Are supermarket chains using inflation as an excuse to increase their profits? We investigate... Also on the programme: how to reduce your bill at the supermarket check-out; all about tamarind, a strange fruit that bring a touch of acidity; and a delicatessen meat from eastern Europe, the kielbasa.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.
